meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah outshouted her friend to be heard over the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The fans outshouted each other to cheer for their favorite team.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outshouted each other to see who could be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outshouted her fear as she screamed with joy.
meanings.sent5: The thunder outshouted the sound of the rain, echoing through the valley.

meanings.definition: To have shouted louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outshouted his opponent in the debate, making his point clear.
meanings.sent2: The singer outshouted the audience, hitting the high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The children outshouted each other in a friendly competition to be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: His determination outshouted his doubts, propelling him forward.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outshouted the music, lighting up the night sky with bursts of color.
